title: refactor(http): consolidate JSON request functions in HTTPClient
body:
## Summary
Consolidate `json_get()` and `json_post()` functions which share 80% identical code.

## Problem
Two functions with nearly identical structure:
- `json_get()` at lines 2414-2453
- `json_post()` at lines 2456-2502

Both set up JSON headers, execute request, and handle response identically.

## Location
- File: `src/http/SocketHTTPClient.c`
- Lines: 2414-2502

## Proposed Solution
Extract shared logic into `httpclient_execute_json(method, url, body, ...)` parameterized helper:
```c
static SocketHTTPClient_Response_T
httpclient_execute_json(SocketHTTPClient_T client, const char *method,
                        const char *url, const char *json_body);
```

Then `json_get()` and `json_post()` become thin wrappers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Single `httpclient_execute_json()` helper function
- [ ] `json_get()` and `json_post()` simplified to wrappers
- [ ] Tests pass with sanitizers
- [ ] ~60 lines saved

## Labels
refactor, redundancy, http
